alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 1:20AM EDT until June 26 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following county, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 120 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monticello, Slickford, Hidalgo, Cooper, Susie, Powersburg, Zula, Sunnybrook, Oil Valley, Burfield, Mount Pisgah and Cabell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
